message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

This paper deals with computer vision and machine learning techniques applied to aerial imagery. Specifically, it proposes a novel strategy for learning to extract semantically meaningful features from aerial imagery by predicting semantic features automatically extracted from co-located ground imagery. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). 

Additionally, the paper also addresses the task of estimating the geolocation and geoorientation of a ground image, which suggests that it could also belong to the cs.RO (Robotics) sub-category. 

The paper also uses an end-to-end learning approach to minimize the difference between the semantic segmentation extracted directly from the ground image and the semantic segmentation predicted solely based on the aerial image, which is a common technique in the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. 

Moreover, the paper proposes an adaptive transformation to map features from the aerial image into the ground-level perspective, which could also be relevant to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. 

Finally, the paper shows how features extracted from an aerial image can be used to hallucinate a plausible ground-level panorama, which could be related to the cs.GR (Graphics) sub-category.
